p:
Assuming that contact between any pair of dogs in the shelter is equally likely, the force of infection is given by λ = βP, where β is the contact rate and P = I/N is the current prevalence of CIV in the shelter [48]. The rate of new infections is given by λS, and susceptible dogs contract the disease an average of 1/λ days after entering the shelter. In this framework, the basic reproductive number of the disease is R 0 = β/(γ+δ), and the disease only persists in the long run if R 0>1, in which case equilibrium prevalence is given by
(1) which is bounded above by δ/(γ+δ) as R 0 becomes large (see Supporting Information, Text S1, Section 1.6).
